   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,

   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(statistics_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Tests the statistics/1 bif.
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   26:          init_per_testcase/2,
   27:          wall_clock_sanity/1,
   28: 	 wall_clock_zero_diff/1, wall_clock_update/1,
   29:          runtime_sanity/1,
   30:          runtime_zero_diff/1,
   31: 	 runtime_update/1, runtime_diff/1,
   32: 	 run_queue_one/1,
   33: 	 scheduler_wall_time/1,
   34:          scheduler_wall_time_all/1,
   35:          msb_scheduler_wall_time/1,
   36: 	 reductions/1, reductions_big/1, garbage_collection/1, io/1,
   37: 	 badarg/1, run_queues_lengths_active_tasks/1, msacc/1]).
   38: 
   39: %% Internal exports.
   40: 
   41: -export([hog/1]).
   42: 
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: 
   45: suite() ->
   46:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   47:      {timetrap, {minutes, 4}}].
   48: 
   49: all() -> 
   50:     [{group, wall_clock}, {group, runtime}, reductions,
   51:      reductions_big, {group, run_queue},
   52:      scheduler_wall_time, scheduler_wall_time_all,
   53:      msb_scheduler_wall_time,
   54:      garbage_collection, io, badarg,
   55:      run_queues_lengths_active_tasks,
   56:      msacc].
   57: 
   58: groups() -> 
   59:     [{wall_clock, [],
   60:       [wall_clock_sanity, wall_clock_zero_diff, wall_clock_update]},
   61:      {runtime, [],
   62:       [runtime_sanity, runtime_zero_diff, runtime_update, runtime_diff]},
   63:      {run_queue, [], [run_queue_one]}].
   64: 
   65: init_per_testcase(msacc, Config) ->
   66:     try erlang:statistics(microstate_accounting) of
   67:         _ ->
   68:             Config
   69:     catch _:_ ->
   70:             {skip, "Microstate accouning not available"}
   71:     end;
   72: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: wall_clock_sanity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   76:     erlang:yield(),
   77:     {WallClock, _} = statistics(wall_clock),
   78:     MT = erlang:monotonic_time(),
   79:     Time = erlang:convert_time_unit(MT - erlang:system_info(start_time),
   80:                                     native, millisecond),
   81:     io:format("Time=~p WallClock=~p~n",
   82:               [Time, WallClock]),
   83:     true = WallClock =< Time,
   84:     true = Time - 100 =< WallClock,
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: %%% Testing statistics(wall_clock).
   88: 
   89: %% Tests that the 'Wall clock since last call' element of the result
   90: %% is zero when statistics(runtime) is called twice in succession.
   91: wall_clock_zero_diff(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   92:     wall_clock_zero_diff1(16).
   93: 
   94: wall_clock_zero_diff1(N) when N > 0 ->
   95:     {Time, _} = statistics(wall_clock),
   96:     case statistics(wall_clock) of
   97:         {Time, 0} -> ok;
   98:         _ -> wall_clock_zero_diff1(N-1)
   99:     end;
  100: wall_clock_zero_diff1(0) ->
  101:     ct:fail("Difference never zero.").
  102: 
  103: %% Test that the time differences returned by two calls to
  104: %% statistics(wall_clock) are compatible, and are within a small number
  105: %% of ms of the amount of real time we waited for.
  106: wall_clock_update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  107:     N = 10,
  108:     Inc = 200,
  109:     TotalTime = wall_clock_update1(N, Inc, 0),
  110:     Overhead = TotalTime - N * Inc,
  111:     IsDebug = test_server:is_debug(),
  112: 
  113:     %% Check that the average overhead is reasonable.
  114:     if
  115:         Overhead < N * 100 ->
  116:             ok;
  117:         IsDebug, Overhead < N * 1000 ->
  118:             ok;
  119:         true ->
  120:             io:format("There was an overhead of ~p ms during ~p rounds.",
  121:                       [Overhead,N]),
  122:             ct:fail(too_much_overhead)
  123:     end.
  124: 
  125: wall_clock_update1(N, Inc, Total) when N > 0 ->
  126:     {Time1, _} = statistics(wall_clock),
  127:     receive after Inc -> ok end,
  128:     {Time2, WcDiff} = statistics(wall_clock),
  129:     WcDiff = Time2 - Time1,
  130:     io:format("Wall clock diff = ~p (expected at least ~p)\n", [WcDiff,Inc]),
  131:     true = WcDiff >= Inc,
  132:     wall_clock_update1(N-1, Inc, Total + WcDiff);
  133: wall_clock_update1(0, _, Total) ->
  134:     Total.
  135: 
  136: 
  137: %%% Test statistics(runtime).
  138: 
  139: runtime_sanity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  140:     case erlang:system_info(logical_processors_available) of
  141:         unknown ->
  142:             {skipped, "Don't know available logical processors"};
  143:         LP when is_integer(LP) ->
  144:             erlang:yield(),
  145:             {RunTime, _} = statistics(runtime),
  146:             MT = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  147:             Time = erlang:convert_time_unit(MT - erlang:system_info(start_time),
  148:                                             native, millisecond),
  149:             io:format("Time=~p RunTime=~p~n",
  150:                       [Time, RunTime]),
  151:             true = RunTime =< Time*LP
  152:     end.
  153: 
  154: %% Tests that the difference between the times returned from two consectuitive
  155: %% calls to statistics(runtime) is zero.
  156: runtime_zero_diff(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  157:     runtime_zero_diff1(16).
  158: 
  159: runtime_zero_diff1(N) when N > 0 ->
  160:     {T1, _} = statistics(runtime),
  161:     case statistics(runtime) of
  162:         {T1, 0} -> ok;
  163:         _ -> runtime_zero_diff1(N-1)
  164:     end;
  165: runtime_zero_diff1(0) ->
  166:     ct:fail("statistics(runtime) never returned zero difference").
  167: 
  168: %% Test that the statistics(runtime) returns a substanstially
  169: %% updated difference after running a process that takes all CPU
  170: %% power of the Erlang process for a second.
  171: runtime_update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  172:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  173:         false ->
  174:             process_flag(priority, high),
  175:             do_runtime_update(10);
  176:         true ->
  177:             {skip,"Cover-compiled"}
  178:     end.
  179: 
  180: do_runtime_update(0) ->
  181:     {comment,"Never close enough"};
  182: do_runtime_update(N) ->
  183:     {T1,Diff0} = statistics(runtime),
  184:     {CPUHog, CPUHogMon} = spawn_opt(fun cpu_heavy/0,[link,monitor]),
  185:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  186:     {T2,Diff} = statistics(runtime),
  187:     unlink(CPUHog),
  188:     exit(CPUHog, kill),
  189:     
  190:     true = is_integer(T1+T2+Diff0+Diff),
  191:     io:format("T1 = ~p, T2 = ~p, Diff = ~p, T2-T1 = ~p", [T1,T2,Diff,T2-T1]),
  192:     receive {'DOWN',CPUHogMon,process,CPUHog,_} -> ok end,
  193:     if
  194:         T2 - T1 =:= Diff, 900 =< Diff, Diff =< 1500 -> ok;
  195:         true -> do_runtime_update(N-1)
  196:     end.
  197: 
  198: cpu_heavy() ->
  199:     cpu_heavy().
  200: 
  201: %% Test that the difference between two consecutive absolute runtimes is
  202: %% equal to the last relative runtime. The loop runs a lot of times since
  203: %% the bug which this test case tests for showed up only rarely.
  204: runtime_diff(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  205:     runtime_diff1(1000).
  206: 
  207: runtime_diff1(N) when N > 0 ->
  208:     {T1_wc_time, _} = statistics(runtime),
  209:     do_much(),
  210:     {T2_wc_time, Wc_Diff} = statistics(runtime),
  211:     Wc_Diff = T2_wc_time - T1_wc_time,
  212:     runtime_diff1(N-1);
  213: runtime_diff1(0) ->
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: %%% do_much(100000) takes about 760 ms on boromir.
  217: %%% do_much(1000) takes about 8 ms on boromir.
  218: 
  219: do_much() ->
  220:     do_much(1000).
  221: 
  222: do_much(0) ->
  223:     ok;
  224: do_much(N) ->
  225:     _ = 4784728478274827 * 72874284728472,
  226:     do_much(N-1).
  227: 
  228: 
  229: %% Test that statistics(reductions) is callable, and that
  230: %% Total_Reductions and Reductions_Since_Last_Call make sense.
  231: %% This to fail on pre-R3A version of JAM.
  232: reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  233:     {Reductions, _} = statistics(reductions),
  234: 
  235:     %% Each loop of reductions/2 takes 4 reductions + that the garbage built
  236:     %% outside the heap in the BIF calls will bump the reductions.
  237:     %% 300 * 4 is more than CONTEXT_REDS (1000).  Thus, there will be one or
  238:     %% more context switches.
  239: 
  240:     Mask = (1 bsl erlang:system_info(wordsize)*8) - 1,
  241:     reductions(300, Reductions, Mask).
  242: 
  243: reductions(N, Previous, Mask) when N > 0 ->
  244:     {Reductions, Diff} = statistics(reductions),
  245:     build_some_garbage(),
  246:     if Reductions > 0 -> ok end,
  247:     if Diff >= 0 -> ok end,
  248:     io:format("Previous = ~p, Reductions = ~p, Diff = ~p, DiffShouldBe = ~p",
  249:               [Previous, Reductions, Diff, (Reductions-Previous) band Mask]),
  250:     if Reductions == ((Previous+Diff) band Mask) -> reductions(N-1, Reductions, Mask) end;
  251: reductions(0, _, _) ->
  252:     ok.
  253: 
  254: build_some_garbage() ->
  255:     %% This will build garbage outside the process heap, which will cause
  256:     %% a garbage collection in the scheduler.
  257:     processes().
  258: 
  259: %% Test that the number of reductions can be returned as a big number.
  260: reductions_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  261:     reductions_big_loop(),
  262:     ok.
  263: 
  264: reductions_big_loop() ->
  265:     erlang:yield(),
  266:     case statistics(reductions) of
  267:         {Red, Diff} when Red >= 16#7ffFFFF ->
  268:             ok = io:format("Reductions = ~w, Diff = ~w", [Red, Diff]);
  269:         _ ->
  270:             reductions_big_loop()
  271:     end.
  272: 
  273: 
  274: %%% Tests of statistics(run_queue).
  275: 
  276: 
  277: %% Tests that statistics(run_queue) returns 1 if we start a
  278: %% CPU-bound process.
  279: run_queue_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block),
  281:     run_queue_one_test(Config),
  282:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock),
  283:     case MS of
  284:         blocked ->
  285:             {comment,
  286:              "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
  287:              "was not written to work with multiple schedulers."};
  288:         _ -> ok
  289:     end.
  290: 
  291: 
  292: run_queue_one_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     _Hog = spawn_link(?MODULE, hog, [self()]),
  294:     receive
  295:         hog_started -> ok
  296:     end,
  297:     receive after 100 -> ok end,		% Give hog a head start.
  298:     case statistics(run_queue) of
  299:         N when N >= 1 -> ok;
  300:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  301:     end,
  302:     ok.
  303: 
  304: %% CPU-bound process, going at low priority.  It will always be ready
  305: %% to run.
  306: 
  307: hog(Pid) ->
  308:     process_flag(priority, low),
  309:     Pid ! hog_started,
  310:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  311:     hog_iter(0, Mon).
  312: 
  313: hog_iter(N, Mon) when N > 0 ->
  314:     receive
  315:         {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->  ok
  316:     after 0 ->
  317:               hog_iter(N-1, Mon)
  318:     end;
  319: hog_iter(0, Mon) ->
  320:     hog_iter(10000, Mon).
  321: 
  322: %%% Tests of statistics(scheduler_wall_time).
  323: 
  324: %% Tests that statistics(scheduler_wall_time) works as intended
  325: scheduler_wall_time(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  326:     scheduler_wall_time_test(scheduler_wall_time).
  327: 
  328: %% Tests that statistics(scheduler_wall_time_all) works as intended
  329: scheduler_wall_time_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  330:     scheduler_wall_time_test(scheduler_wall_time_all).
  331: 
  332: scheduler_wall_time_test(Type) ->
  333:     case string:find(erlang:system_info(system_version),
  334:                      "dirty-schedulers-TEST") == nomatch of
  335:         true -> run_scheduler_wall_time_test(Type);
  336:         false -> {skip, "Cannot be run with dirty-schedulers-TEST build"}
  337:     end.
  338: 
  339: run_scheduler_wall_time_test(Type) ->
  340:     %% Should return undefined if system_flag is not turned on yet
  341:     undefined = statistics(Type),
  342:     %% Turn on statistics
  343:     false = erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time, true),
  344:     try
  345:         Schedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  346:         DirtyCPUSchedulers = erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers_online),
  347:         DirtyIOSchedulers = erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers),
  348:         TotLoadSchedulers = case Type of
  349:                                 scheduler_wall_time_all ->
  350:                                     Schedulers + DirtyCPUSchedulers + DirtyIOSchedulers;
  351:                                 scheduler_wall_time ->
  352:                                     Schedulers + DirtyCPUSchedulers
  353:                         end,
  354: 
  355:         Env = [io_lib:format("~ts~n",[KV]) || KV <- os:getenv()],
  356: 
  357:         ct:log("Env:~n~ts",[Env]),
  358: 
  359:         ct:log("Schedulers:               ~p~n"
  360:                "SchedulersOnline:         ~p~n"
  361:                "DirtyCPUSchedulers:       ~p~n"
  362:                "DirtyCPUSchedulersOnline: ~p~n"
  363:                "DirtyIOSchedulersOnline:  ~p~n",
  364:                [erlang:system_info(schedulers),
  365:                 Schedulers,
  366:                 erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers),
  367:                 DirtyCPUSchedulers,
  368:                 DirtyIOSchedulers]),
  369: 
  370:         %% Assert that number of schedulers is the same as number of dirty schedulers
  371:         Schedulers = DirtyCPUSchedulers,
  372: 
  373:         %% Let testserver and everyone else finish their work
  374:         timer:sleep(1500),
  375:         %% Empty load
  376:         EmptyLoad = get_load(Type),
  377:         {false, _} = {lists:any(fun(Load) -> Load > 50 end, EmptyLoad),EmptyLoad},
  378:         MeMySelfAndI = self(),
  379:         StartHog = fun() ->
  380:                            Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, hog, [self()]),
  381:                            receive hog_started -> MeMySelfAndI ! go end,
  382:                            Pid
  383:                    end,
  384:         StartDirtyHog = fun(Func) ->
  385:                                 F = fun() ->
  386:                                             erts_debug:Func(alive_waitexiting,
  387:                                                             MeMySelfAndI)
  388:                                     end,
  389:                                 Pid = spawn_link(F),
  390:                                 receive {alive, Pid} -> ok end,
  391:                                 Pid
  392:                         end,
  393:         P1 = StartHog(),
  394:         %% Max on one, the other schedulers empty (hopefully)
  395:         %% Be generous the process can jump between schedulers
  396:         %% which is ok and we don't want the test to fail for wrong reasons
  397:         _L1 = [S1Load|EmptyScheds1] = get_load(Type),
  398:         {true,_}  = {S1Load > 50,S1Load},
  399:         {false,_} = {lists:any(fun(Load) -> Load > 50 end, EmptyScheds1),EmptyScheds1},
  400:         {true,_}  = {lists:sum(EmptyScheds1) < 60,EmptyScheds1},
  401: 
  402:         %% 50% load
  403:         HalfHogs = [StartHog() || _ <- lists:seq(1, (Schedulers-1) div 2)],
  404:         HalfDirtyCPUHogs = [StartDirtyHog(dirty_cpu)
  405:                             || _ <- lists:seq(1, lists:max([1,DirtyCPUSchedulers div 2]))],
  406:         HalfDirtyIOHogs = [StartDirtyHog(dirty_io)
  407:                            || _ <- lists:seq(1, lists:max([1,DirtyIOSchedulers div 2]))],
  408:         HalfScheds = get_load(Type),
  409:         ct:log("HalfScheds: ~w",[HalfScheds]),
  410:         HalfLoad = lists:sum(HalfScheds) div TotLoadSchedulers,
  411:         if Schedulers =:= 1, HalfLoad > 80 -> ok; %% Ok only one scheduler online and one hog
  412:            %% We want roughly 50% load
  413:            HalfLoad > 40, HalfLoad < 60 -> ok;
  414:            true -> exit({halfload, HalfLoad})
  415:         end,
  416: 
  417:         %% 100% load. Need to take into consideration an odd number of
  418:         %% schedulers and also special consideration for when there is
  419:         %% only 1 scheduler
  420:         LastHogs = [StartHog() || _ <- lists:seq(1, (Schedulers+1) div 2),
  421:                                   Schedulers =/= 1],
  422:         LastDirtyCPUHogs = [StartDirtyHog(dirty_cpu)
  423:                             || _ <- lists:seq(1, (DirtyCPUSchedulers+1) div 2),
  424:                                    DirtyCPUSchedulers =/= 1],
  425:         LastDirtyIOHogs = [StartDirtyHog(dirty_io)
  426:                            || _ <- lists:seq(1, (DirtyIOSchedulers+1) div 2),
  427:                                    DirtyIOSchedulers =/= 1],
  428:         FullScheds = get_load(Type),
  429:         ct:log("FullScheds: ~w",[FullScheds]),
  430:         {false,_} = {lists:any(fun(Load) -> Load < 80 end, FullScheds),FullScheds},
  431:         FullLoad = lists:sum(FullScheds) div TotLoadSchedulers,
  432:         if FullLoad > 90 -> ok;
  433:            true -> exit({fullload, FullLoad})
  434:         end,
  435: 
  436: 	KillHog = fun (HP) ->
  437: 			  HPM = erlang:monitor(process, HP),
  438:                           unlink(HP),
  439: 			  exit(HP, kill),
  440: 			  receive
  441: 			      {'DOWN', HPM, process, HP, killed} ->
  442: 				  ok
  443: 			  end
  444: 		  end,
  445:         [KillHog(Pid) || Pid <- [P1|HalfHogs++HalfDirtyCPUHogs++HalfDirtyIOHogs
  446:                                  ++LastHogs++LastDirtyCPUHogs++LastDirtyIOHogs]],
  447:         receive after 2000 -> ok end, %% Give dirty schedulers time to complete...
  448:         AfterLoad = get_load(Type),
  449: 	io:format("AfterLoad=~p~n", [AfterLoad]),
  450:         {false,_} = {lists:any(fun(Load) -> Load > 25 end, AfterLoad),AfterLoad},
  451:         true = erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time, false)
  452:     after
  453:         erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time, false)
  454:     end.
  455: 
  456: get_load(Type) ->
  457:     Start = erlang:statistics(Type),
  458:     timer:sleep(1500),
  459:     End = erlang:statistics(Type),
  460: 
  461:     lists:reverse(
  462:       lists:sort(load_percentage(online_statistics(Start),online_statistics(End)))).
  463: 
  464: %% We are only interested in schedulers that are online to remove all
  465: %% offline normal and dirty cpu schedulers (dirty io cannot be offline)
  466: online_statistics(Stats) ->
  467:     Schedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
  468:     SchedulersOnline = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  469:     DirtyCPUSchedulers = erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers),
  470:     DirtyCPUSchedulersOnline = erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers_online),
  471:     DirtyIOSchedulersOnline = erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers),
  472:     SortedStats = lists:sort(Stats),
  473:     ct:log("Stats: ~p~n", [SortedStats]),
  474:     SchedulersStats =
  475:         lists:sublist(SortedStats, 1, SchedulersOnline),
  476:     DirtyCPUSchedulersStats =
  477:         lists:sublist(SortedStats, Schedulers+1, DirtyCPUSchedulersOnline),
  478:     DirtyIOSchedulersStats =
  479:         lists:sublist(SortedStats, Schedulers + DirtyCPUSchedulers+1, DirtyIOSchedulersOnline),
  480:     SchedulersStats ++ DirtyCPUSchedulersStats ++ DirtyIOSchedulersStats.
  481: 
  482: load_percentage([{Id, WN, TN}|Ss], [{Id, WP, TP}|Ps]) ->
  483:     [100*(WN-WP) div (TN-TP)|load_percentage(Ss, Ps)];
  484: load_percentage([], []) -> [].
  485: 
  486: count(0) ->
  487:     ok;
  488: count(N) ->
  489:     count(N-1).
  490: 
  491: msb_swt_hog(true) ->
  492:     count(1000000),
  493:     erts_debug:dirty_cpu(wait, 10),
  494:     erts_debug:dirty_io(wait, 10),
  495:     msb_swt_hog(true);
  496: msb_swt_hog(false) ->
  497:     count(1000000),
  498:     msb_swt_hog(false).
  499: 
  500: msb_scheduler_wall_time(_Config) ->
  501:     erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time, true),
  502:     Dirty = erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers) /= 0,
  503:     Hogs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  504:                              spawn_opt(fun () ->
  505:                                                msb_swt_hog(Dirty)
  506:                                        end, [{priority,low}, link, monitor])
  507:                      end, lists:seq(1,10)),
  508:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block),
  509:     try
  510:         SWT1 = lists:sort(statistics(scheduler_wall_time_all)),
  511:         %% io:format("SWT1 = ~p~n", [SWT1]),
  512:         receive after 4000 -> ok end,
  513:         SWT2 = lists:sort(statistics(scheduler_wall_time_all)),
  514:         %% io:format("SWT2 = ~p~n", [SWT2]),
  515:         SWT = lists:zip(SWT1, SWT2),
  516:         io:format("SU = ~p~n", [lists:map(fun({{I, A0, T0}, {I, A1, T1}}) ->
  517:                                                   {I, (A1 - A0)/(T1 - T0)} end,
  518:                                          SWT)]),
  519:         {A, T} = lists:foldl(fun({{_, A0, T0}, {_, A1, T1}}, {Ai,Ti}) ->
  520:                                      {Ai + (A1 - A0), Ti + (T1 - T0)}
  521:                              end,
  522:                              {0, 0},
  523:                              SWT),
  524:         TSU = A/T,
  525:         WSU = ((TSU * (erlang:system_info(schedulers)
  526:                        + erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers)
  527:                        + erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers)))
  528:                / 1),
  529:         %% Weighted scheduler utilization should be
  530:         %% very close to 1.0, i.e., we execute the
  531:         %% same time as one thread executing all
  532:         %% the time...
  533:         io:format("WSU = ~p~n", [WSU]),
  534:         true = 0.9 < WSU andalso WSU < 1.1,
  535:         ok
  536:     after
  537:         erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock),
  538:         erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time, false),
  539:         lists:foreach(fun ({HP, _HM}) ->
  540:                               unlink(HP),
  541:                               exit(HP, kill)
  542:                       end, Hogs),
  543:         lists:foreach(fun ({HP, HM}) ->
  544:                               receive
  545:                                   {'DOWN', HM, process, HP, _} ->
  546:                                       ok
  547:                               end
  548:                       end, Hogs),
  549:         ok
  550:     end.
  551: 
  552: %% Tests that statistics(garbage_collection) is callable.
  553: %% It is not clear how to test anything more.
  554: garbage_collection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  555:     Bin = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(19999, 42)),
  556:     case statistics(garbage_collection) of
  557:         {Gcs0,R,0} when is_integer(Gcs0), is_integer(R) ->
  558:             io:format("Reclaimed: ~p", [R]),
  559:             Gcs = garbage_collection_1(Gcs0, Bin),
  560:             io:format("Reclaimed: ~p",
  561:                       [element(2, statistics(garbage_collection))]),
  562:             {comment,integer_to_list(Gcs-Gcs0)++" GCs"}
  563:     end.
  564: 
  565: garbage_collection_1(Gcs0, Bin) ->
  566:     case statistics(garbage_collection) of
  567:         {Gcs,Reclaimed,0} when Gcs >= Gcs0 ->
  568:             if
  569:                 Reclaimed > 16#7ffffff ->
  570:                     Gcs;
  571:                 true ->
  572:                     _ = binary_to_list(Bin),
  573:                     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  574:                     garbage_collection_1(Gcs, Bin)
  575:             end
  576:     end.
  577: 
  578: %% Tests that statistics(io) is callable.
  579: %% This could be improved to test something more.
  580: io(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  581:     case statistics(io) of
  582:         {{input,In},{output,Out}} when is_integer(In), is_integer(Out) -> ok
  583:     end.
  584: 
  585: %% Tests that some illegal arguments to statistics fails.
  586: badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     case catch statistics(1) of
  588:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok
  589:     end,
  590:     case catch statistics(bad_atom) of
  591:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok
  592:     end.
  593: 
  594: tok_loop() ->
  595:     tok_loop().
  596: 
  597: run_queues_lengths_active_tasks(_Config) ->
  598:     TokLoops = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  599:                                  spawn_opt(fun () ->
  600:                                                    tok_loop()
  601:                                            end,
  602:                                            [link, {priority, low}])
  603:                          end,
  604:                          lists:seq(1,10)),
  605: 
  606:                    
  607: 
  608:     TRQLs0 = statistics(total_run_queue_lengths),
  609:     TRQLAs0 = statistics(total_run_queue_lengths_all),
  610:     TATs0 = statistics(total_active_tasks),
  611:     TATAs0 = statistics(total_active_tasks_all),
  612:     true = is_integer(TRQLs0),
  613:     true = is_integer(TATs0),
  614:     true = TRQLs0 >= 0,
  615:     true = TRQLAs0 >= 0,
  616:     true = TATs0 >= 11,
  617:     true = TATAs0 >= 11,
  618: 
  619:     NoScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
  620:     {DefRqs,
  621:      AllRqs} = case erlang:system_info(dirty_cpu_schedulers) of
  622:                    0 -> {NoScheds, NoScheds};
  623:                    _ -> {NoScheds+1, NoScheds+2}
  624:                end,
  625:     RQLs0 = statistics(run_queue_lengths),
  626:     RQLAs0 = statistics(run_queue_lengths_all),
  627:     ATs0 = statistics(active_tasks),
  628:     ATAs0 = statistics(active_tasks_all),
  629:     DefRqs = length(RQLs0),
  630:     AllRqs = length(RQLAs0),
  631:     DefRqs = length(ATs0),
  632:     AllRqs = length(ATAs0),
  633:     true = lists:sum(RQLs0) >= 0,
  634:     true = lists:sum(RQLAs0) >= 0,
  635:     true = lists:sum(ATs0) >= 11,
  636:     true = lists:sum(ATAs0) >= 11,
  637: 
  638:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
  639: 
  640:     %% Give newly suspended schedulers some time to
  641:     %% migrate away work from their run queues...
  642:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  643: 
  644:     TRQLs1 = statistics(total_run_queue_lengths),
  645:     TATs1 = statistics(total_active_tasks),
  646:     true = TRQLs1 >= 10,
  647:     true = TATs1 >= 11,
  648:     NoScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
  649: 
  650:     RQLs1 = statistics(run_queue_lengths),
  651:     ATs1 = statistics(active_tasks),
  652:     DefRqs = length(RQLs1),
  653:     DefRqs = length(ATs1),
  654:     TRQLs2 = lists:sum(RQLs1),
  655:     TATs2 = lists:sum(ATs1),
  656:     true = TRQLs2 >= 10,
  657:     true = TATs2 >= 11,
  658:     [TRQLs2|_] = RQLs1,
  659:     [TATs2|_] = ATs1,
  660: 
  661:     erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO),
  662: 
  663:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  664:                           unlink(P),
  665:                           exit(P, bang)
  666:                   end,
  667:                   TokLoops),
  668: 
  669:     ok.
  670: 
  671: %% Tests that statistics(microstate_statistics) works.
  672: msacc(Config) ->
  673: 
  674:     %% Test if crypto nif is available
  675:     Niff = try crypto:strong_rand_bytes(1), ok catch _:_ -> nok end,
  676:     TmpFile = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),"file.tmp"),
  677: 
  678:     false = erlang:system_flag(microstate_accounting, true),
  679: 
  680:     msacc_test(TmpFile),
  681: 
  682:     true = erlang:system_flag(microstate_accounting, false),
  683: 
  684:     MsaccStats = erlang:statistics(microstate_accounting),
  685: 
  686:     case os:type() of
  687:         {win32, _} ->
  688:             %% Some windows have a very poor accuracy on their
  689:             %% timing primitives, so we just make sure that
  690:             %% some state besides sleep has been triggered.
  691:             Sum = lists:sum(
  692:                     lists:map(fun({sleep, _V}) -> 0;
  693:                                  ({_, V}) -> V
  694:                               end, maps:to_list(msacc_sum_states()))
  695:                    ),
  696:             if Sum > 0 ->
  697:                    ok;
  698:                true ->
  699:                    ct:fail({no_states_triggered, MsaccStats})
  700:             end;
  701:         _ ->
  702: 
  703:             %% Make sure that all states were triggered at least once
  704:             maps:map(fun(nif, 0) ->
  705:                              case Niff of
  706:                                  ok ->
  707:                                      ct:fail({zero_state,nif});
  708:                                  nok ->
  709:                                      ok
  710:                              end;
  711:                         (aux, 0) ->
  712:                              %% aux will be zero if we do not have smp support
  713:                              %% or no async threads
  714:                              case erlang:system_info(thread_pool_size) > 0 of
  715:                                  false ->
  716:                                      ok;
  717:                                  true ->
  718:                                      ct:log("msacc: ~p",[MsaccStats]),
  719:                                      ct:fail({zero_state,aux})
  720:                              end;
  721:                         (Key, 0) ->
  722:                              ct:log("msacc: ~p",[MsaccStats]),
  723:                              ct:fail({zero_state,Key});
  724:                         (_,_) -> ok
  725:                      end, msacc_sum_states())
  726:     end,
  727: 
  728:     erlang:system_flag(microstate_accounting, reset),
  729: 
  730:     msacc_test(TmpFile),
  731: 
  732:     %% Make sure all counters are zero after stopping and resetting
  733:     maps:map(fun(_Key, 0) -> ok;
  734:                 (Key,_) ->
  735:                      ct:log("msacc: ~p",[erlang:statistics(microstate_accounting)]),
  736:                      ct:fail({non_zero_state,Key})
  737:              end,msacc_sum_states()).
  738: 
  739: %% This test tries to make sure to trigger all of the different available states
  740: msacc_test(TmpFile) ->
  741: 
  742:     %% We write some data
  743:     [file:write_file(TmpFile,<<0:(1024*1024*8)>>,[raw]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  744: 
  745:     %% Do some ETS operations
  746:     Tid = ets:new(table, []),
  747:     ets:insert(Tid, {1, hello}),
  748:     ets:delete(Tid),
  749: 
  750:     %% Check some IO
  751:     {ok, L} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active, true},{reuseaddr,true}]),
  752:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
  753:     _Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  754:                          {ok, _S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  755:                          (fun F() -> receive _M -> F() end end)()
  756:                 end),
  757:     {ok, C} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost", Port, []),
  758:     [begin gen_tcp:send(C,"hello"),timer:sleep(1) end || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  759: 
  760:     %% Collect some garbage
  761:     [erlang:garbage_collect() || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  762: 
  763:     %% Send some messages
  764:     [begin self() ! {hello},receive _ -> ok end end ||  _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  765: 
  766:     %% Setup some timers
  767:     Refs = [erlang:send_after(10000,self(),ok) ||  _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  768: 
  769:     %% Do some nif work
  770:     catch [crypto:strong_rand_bytes(128) || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  771: 
  772:     %% Cancel some timers
  773:     [erlang:cancel_timer(R) ||  R <- Refs],
  774: 
  775:     %% Wait for a while
  776:     timer:sleep(100).
  777: 
  778: msacc_sum_states() ->
  779:     Stats = erlang:statistics(microstate_accounting),
  780:     [#{ counters := C }|_] = Stats,
  781:     InitialCounters = maps:map(fun(_,_) -> 0 end,C),
  782:     lists:foldl(fun(#{ counters := Counters }, Cnt) ->
  783:                         maps:fold(fun(Key, Value, Acc) ->
  784:                                           NewValue = Value+maps:get(Key,Acc),
  785:                                           maps:update(Key, NewValue, Acc)
  786:                                   end, Cnt, Counters)
  787:                 end,InitialCounters,Stats).
